name: Scott Schmidt
title: Software Engineer
about: Engineer with three years of experience building products from the ground up. A team player, who is comfortable working independently and with others. Especially adept at facilitating conversation between engineering and product teams to help engineers understand business requirements and help product managers understand the work that goes into building and maintaining software.

positions.title: Engineering Team Lead
positions.blurb: Working directly under the CTO, I helped lead a small group of engineers. In addition to writing code, I also conducted code reviews, architected new services/features, and acted as liaison between engineering and product teams to help translate business needs into engineering outcomes.
bulletPoints: Created and administered infrastructure on AWS. Used services such as DMS, EC2, ECR, ECS, ElastiCache, ElasticSearch, RDS, and S3.
Wrote web scrapers in Python using various tools such as Selenium, BeautifulSoup, and Requests to retrieve data from multiple sources. Scaled these scrapers to complete thousands of tasks per day.

Using Flask, uWSGI, and Jinja, built and managed multiple internal web apps for various tasks. These apps supported processes such as submitting and editing data on the end-user product or orchestrating what sources our scrapers should scrape and when.
Built and managed micro-services for internal use by engineers. One such service translated Chinese strings into English using an in-house data store. Used Flask JSON-RPC to expose an API layer.

Wrote Python scripts to support the ETL pipeline that prepared the raw scraped data for use with the end-user product. Consistently iterated on these scripts to significantly decrease run time, utilizing tools like Python's Multiprocessing library to run parallel processes.
Added new features to the end-user product, such as front-end designs or API endpoints. The product was a Django web app with a Python back-end and React.js front-end.

positions.title: Software Engineer
positions.blurb: This was a multi-faceted full stack position where I worked across both research and engineering functions to help build the product using an Agile method of development. With a small team, we built the alpha prototype which led to a seed investment by a venture capital firm.

positions.title: Research Assistant
positions.blurb: Worked part-time while continuing to take college classes. Responsibilities included strategic planning and development of business/product processes using a combination of qualitative research and data analysis.
